intro: Bunium luteum, commonly known as yellow bishop's hat, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and the Middle East. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and distinctive umbellate inflorescences. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky or arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
